title: Aranleón 2014 Sólo Tinto Organic Wine Red (Utiel-Requena)
description: This stewy blend of 80% Bobal with Tempranillo and Syrah leads with foxy, murky aromas. Its weedy berry flavors are overoaked, seeming messy and unbalanced.

title: Côtnar Hills 2014 Chardonnay (Ukraine)
description: Subtle aromas of citrus and pineapple lead to grapefruit and lemon flavors and a crisp finish.

title: Côtnar Hills 2014 Gorobchiki Semi-Dry Traminer (Ukraine)
description: This wine has perfumed aromas of apricot and peach flowers. Flavors of white peach and passion fruit combine with dried Mediterranean herbs for a somewhat savory finish.

title: Casas del Toqui 2013 Barrel Series Reserva Carmenère (Cachapoal Valley)
description: Oaky green aromas are all over the map, with notes of sandalwood soap, barrel spice and most prominent of all, horse hide. A dense syrupy palate is heavy and untamed, while blackberry flavors are at first spicy but later turn more weedy, horsey and difficult.

title: Tarantas NV Made With Organic Grapes Sparkling (Spain)
description: This red-colored sparkler is foxy and funky on the nose. On the palate, it's soda-like in composition, with raspberry flavors that persist on the finish.

title: Omen 2015 Pinot Noir (Rogue Valley)
description: There is barely a trace of any varietal fruit character here. The wine seems soaked in vanilla, probably from some sort of oak treatment. Whatever the cause, it's vanilla all the way from start to finish.

title: Bellora 2016  Bardolino Chiaretto
description: The shy nose doesn't give much away while the lean diluted palate offers the barest sensations of unripe red berry. Brisk acidity gives it an abrupt finish.

title: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2016 Le Bordeaux Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This wine is bland, soft and clean, with little in the way of fruitiness.

title: Eliana 2013 Merlot (Rogue Valley)
description: This pure varietal spent 40 months in neutral oak, and is the current release. It's volatile, raisined, even pruney. Let's call it rustic to a fault, with alcohol approaching 16% adding to a hot finish.

title: Indomita 2016 Gran Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)
description: Year after year, Indomita puts out acceptable Chardonnays; and in a difficult 2016, that's even more the case. This smells like a hay barn, with a dense, out of shape palate. Briny stone-fruit flavors are acceptable but lacking.

title: Finca La Estacada 2015 Ocho y Media Malbec (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Exotic cardamom and mint notes turn green the longer this rough wine breathes. Its narrow palate recalls alfalfa, mint and boysenberry, helping explain why Malbec is almost nonexistent in Spain.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Lacheteau 2016 Champteloup  (Rosé d'Anjou)
description: This sweet rosé with its strange candy color and flavor is made to drink now. It is fruity and clean with attractive acidity alongside light texture. It is very much a crisp summer drink.

title: Château Mezain 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This is a yeasty, bready wine. It has plenty of flavor that masks the fruit, but not the right flavors.

title: Château Anniche 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This light, bland wine lacks character. It is clean and does have some fruitiness.

title: Feudi del Pisciotto 2015 Grillo (Terre Siciliane)
description: This has subdued aromas of toast, weedy underbrush and a medicinal note. It's lean and diluted, with toast, oak and a hint of bitter yellow-apple skin before an abrupt astringent finish.

title: Château Panchille 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This tastes more like candy than wine, with a hint of sweetness within the acidity. It is out of balance.

title: Altavins 2011 Almodí Petit Red (Terra Alta)
description: This blend of Garnacha, Syrah, Merlot and Samsó (Carignan) smells like a burning field. A tight, pulling palate holds underripe, herbal red fruit and turnip flavors. It's both hot and herbal-tasting on the finish.

title: Mont Rubí 2015 Gaintus One Night's Rosé (Penedès)
description: This pulpy and highly acidic rosé is made from the obscure Sumoll grape. Its flavors are at once bready and tart, feeling hollow and oxidized on the finish.

title: Santa Cruz de Alpera 2016 Rosé (Almansa)
description: This Almansa rosé sends out warning signals in the form of foxy plum skin aromas. Its strained flavors are green and reminiscent of vinegar, and the finish is weak.

title: Trencalòs 2015 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Jammy, foxy, volatile aromas do little to draw one into this subpar Tempranillo. Its underripe, underwhelming roasted berry flavors finish dull and hollow.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Sierra Norte 2011 Cerro Bercial Madurado en Barrica Red (Utiel-Requena)
description: Reduced, malted, raisiny aromas in this blend of 65% Tempranillo and 35% Bobal suggest overripeness or premature evolution. It's tannic on the palate and tastes as stewy as prune juice.

title: Alta Alella 2016 Tallarol Organic Pansa Blanca (Alella)
description: This no-sulfur wine from a hot vintage is prematurely oxidized, with corn and cornbread aromas. Its dilute palate holds bland flavors that are both bready and bitter, and it finishes short.

title: Macauley 2014 Special Selected Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Knights Valley)
description: Mac Watson honors the memory of a wine once made by his mother in this tremendously delicious, balanced and complex botrytised white. Dark gold in color, it layers toasted hazelnut, pear compote and orange peel flavors, reveling in the succulence of its 122 g/L of residual sugar.

title: Heitz 2012 Martha's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This tremendous 100% varietal wine hails from Oakville and was aged over three years in oak. Juicy red-cherry fruit and a compelling hint of caramel greet the palate, framed by elegant, fine tannins and a subtle minty tone in the background. Balanced and rewarding from start to finish, it has years ahead of it to develop further nuance. Enjoy 2022–2030.

title: Bodega Carmen Rodríguez 2012 Carodorum Selección Especial Reserva  (Toro)
description: Ripe aromas of fig, blackberry and cassis are softened and sweetened by a slathering of oaky chocolate and vanilla. This is full, layered, intense and cushioned on the palate, with rich flavors of chocolaty black fruits and baking spices. A toasty, everlasting finish is heady but ideally balanced. Drink through 2023.

title: Ponzi 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This spent 20 months in 30% new French oak, and incorporates fruit from Ponzi's Aurora, Abetina and Madrona vineyards, among others. Aromatic, dense and toasty, it deftly blends aromas and flavors of toast, cigar box, blackberry, black cherry, coffee and graphite. Tannins are polished to a fine sheen, and frame a finish loaded with dark chocolate and espresso. Drink now through 2032.

title: Numanthia 2012 Numanthia  (Toro)
description: Deep, dense and pure from the opening bell, this Toro is a winner. Aromas of dark ripe black fruits are cool and moderately oaked. This feels massive on the palate but sensationally balanced. Flavors of blackberry, coffee, mocha and toasty oak finish spicy, smooth and heady. Drink this exemplary Toro through 2023.

title: Patricia Green Cellars 2015 Weber Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: A standout even in this terrific lineup of 2015 releases from Patricia Green, the Weber opens with a burst of cola and tobacco scents and accents. It continues, subtle and detailed, with flavors of oranges, vanilla, tea and milk chocolate discreetly threaded through ripe blackberry fruit.

title: Gary Farrell 2014 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This fresh and lively medium-bodied wine is beautifully crafted, with cherry blossom aromas and tangy acidity. Layered and seductive, it offers a crisp mix of orange peel, cherry, pomegranate and baking spice flavors that are ready for the table or the cellar.

title: Bergström 2014 Sigrid Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: First made in 2006, this succulent luscious Chardonnay is all about minerality. It's got a rich core of butterscotch and the seemingly endless layers of subtle flavors that biodynamic farming can bring. It spends 18 months on the lees prior to bottling. Drink now through 2028.
